Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Steven Cohen Collection on the James Madison Coalition to End the War
Cohen, Steven, 1953 Sept. 6-
Cohen, Robert, 1955 May 21-
TAM.781
.25 linear feet in 1 folder in shared housing
1976-1977 Steven A. Cohen (1953- ) is an American academic focusing on public management and environmental policy. He is a Professor of Practice of Public Affairs at Columbia University's School of International and Public Affairs, Director of the school's Master of Public Administration in Environmental Science and Policy, and the Director of the Master of Science in Sustainability Management. Cohen graduated from James Madison High School in Brooklyn, New York in 1970. This collection consists of materials collected by Cohen related to the James Madison Coalition to End the War from approximately 1968-1970 documenting the student group's organizing efforts at James Madison High School in Brooklyn, New York in opposition to United States involvement in the Vietnam War. Materials include flyers announcing group meetings and demonstrations and documents with talking points and issue briefs on anti-Vietnam and general anti-war organizing. The collection also includes a letter to parents describing the group's anti-war position signed by multiple parties, including Selma Schumer, then President of the Parents' Association and mother to New York Senator Chuck Schumer. Materials are in English.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of materials collected by Steven Cohen related to the James Madison Coalition to End the War from approximately 1968-1970 documenting the student group's organizing efforts at James Madison High School in Brooklyn, New York in opposition to United States involvement in the Vietnam War. Materials include flyers announcing group meetings and demonstrations and documents with talking points and issue briefs on anti-Vietnam and general anti-war organizing. The collection also includes a letter to parents describing the group's anti-war position signed by multiple parties, including Selma Schumer, then President of the Parents' Association and mother to New York Senator Chuck Schumer.
Biographical Note
Steven A. Cohen (1953- ) is an American academic focusing on public management and environmental policy. He is a Professor of Practice of Public Affairs at Columbia University's School of International and Public Affairs, Director of the school's Master of Public Administration in Environmental Science and Policy, and the Director of the Master of Science in Sustainability Management. He is the former director of Columbia University's Earth Institute, and had previously served as a policy analyst for the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Cohen graduated from James Madison High School in Brooklyn, New York in 1970, and was an active in the James Madison Coalition to End of the War.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Robert Cohen, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2018 by the donor. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Robert Cohen in 2018; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.063.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Guide to the Robert Cohen Collection on the James Madison Coalition to End the War; TAM 781; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an archival box and folder and described on the collection-level.
